author: pipermerriam
content: <@!194432762315407360> this is an implementation detail but our RLP library doesn't like the request id's that you've generated in the test vectors due to them being encoded with extra leading zeros.

author: .fjl
content: You can just decode them as byte arrays

author: pipermerriam
content: oh, interesting, üëç I'll change to using bytes

author: pipermerriam
content: looking at the spec it doesn't appear the updates to the whoareyou packet have been committed (reducing the signature nonce to 16 bytes and using the 16 random iv bytes).  Is that correct?  I expected to need to make some changes to my implementation but right now it appears to be inline with the spec (though I'm still working my way through things)

author: .fjl
content: Yes, some things aren't in yet

author: .fjl
content: I've mostly been busy updating my own implementation

author: pipermerriam
content: At least me and one other person working towards the latest spec that would benefit from something like a clear list of what changes are not currently represented in the pull request.
